info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 26 at 5:41PM EDT until May 26 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Tornado Warning for... North central Catawba County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Alexander County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... East central Caldwell County in western North Carolina... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 541 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 6 miles southwest of Taylorsville, or 4 miles north of Bethlehem, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Taylorsville around 550 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this dangerous thunderstorm include Vashti, Hiddenite, Millersville, Ellendale and Little River In Alexander County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
